title: 2D kinematics - comparing v and a in 2 cases

content.question: Two objects, Object <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Object <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, have velocities <math alttext="Vector v sub 1 equals, open parenthesis, 3 times t squared, times i hat, plus 5 t, times j hat, close parenthesis, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>t</mi><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="Vector v sub 2 equals, open parenthesis, 5 times t squared, times i hat, minus 3 t, times j hat, close parenthesis, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is time in seconds. Which of the following correctly indicates the relationship between the magnitudes of the acceleration <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> of Object <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> at <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> and the acceleration <math alttext="a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of Object <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> at <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext> s</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub 1 is less than a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="a sub 1 is greater than a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="a sub 1 equals a sub 2, which is not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="a sub 1 equals a sub 2, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a sub 1 is less than a sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
